hook.text: What if the solution to climate change is less growth, not more? Degrowth says the economy must shrink to survive.

buildup.text: Degrowth challenges the idea that GDP growth is always good. It argues endless growth destroys the planet.

discovery.text: Rich nations consume far more than their share. Degrowth says they should consume less so the planet can recover.

twist.text: No politician wins elections by promising less. Degrowth faces a political wall even if the science supports it.

climax.text: Green growth ‚Äî growing the economy while cutting emissions ‚Äî is the mainstream alternative. But is it enough?

punchline.text: Growth built the modern world. Can it survive its own costs?

quiz.question: What does the degrowth movement argue?
options: Rich nations should reduce consumption to prevent environmental collapse
All economic growth is always beneficial
Only poor nations need to limit their growth
